info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 8 at 3:20PM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas...
Saline River Near Rye affecting Drew, Ashley, Bradley and Cleveland Counties.
For the Saline River...including Benton, Rye...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Saline River near Rye.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Marsh and timberlands along the river flooded. Logging equipment should be moved to higher ground. At 26.0 feet, County roads in Eastern Bradley County flooded. Move equipment and other property out of low lying areas of the floodplain. At 28.0 feet, County roads in Southwestern Drew and Eastern Bradley counties may be flooded. Some homes and cabins may be isolated by high water. At 29.0 feet, Railroad Bridge across the river east of Warren effected. State Highway 8 in Eastern Bradley County may be flooded. State Highway 8 Bridge at Longview between Ashley and Bradley counties and numerous county roads along the river flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon (April 8) and continue rising to a crest of 29.0 feet by early Thursday afternoon (April 10). - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 330 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Ashley, AR; Bradley, AR; Cleveland, AR; Drew, AR
